conclusion: Plan to analyze processes in p-V diagram and calculate work done.
p-V diagram with pressure on vertical axis and volume on horizontal axis, showing processes A→B, B→C, and C→A.
Initial state A with temperature 200 K, lines connecting states.
Process A→B: Gas expands, pressure decreases from 4 × 10^5 Pa to 1 × 10^5 Pa.
Process B→C: Gas expands further, pressure decreases from 1 × 10^5 Pa to 0.
Process C→A: Gas compresses, pressure increases from 0 to 4 × 10^5 Pa.
Work done for each process calculated using \( W = \int_{V_1}^{V_2} p \, dV \).
Work done by gas is positive for processes A→B and B→C.
Work done by external environment on gas is negative for process C→A.
Net work done during cycle is zero since gas returns to initial state.
Work done from C to A is area under curve from C to A.
Using ideal gas equation \( pV = nRT \) to calculate work done.
Work done calculated as \( W = nRT \log\left(\frac{V_A}{V_C}\right) \).
Final answer: Work done by external environment is 328.4 J.
